Who is Dante De Ruwe?

A 20 year old Belgian Student

I study in the city of Ghent, Belgium. A passion for science is what brought me here, to Ghent University, where I studied physics and astronomy for 2 years. Yet; the IT virus had bitten me since my first ever programming class and had taken me over by the end of 2017. I made the decision to change plans and went on to persue a degree in applied information technology at Ghent University College.

A Passionate Developer

I enjoy experimenting, tinkering and just making things work. Often this means teaching myself a whole bunch of new stuff, just as I need them; this has always been my favorite way to learn about new technologies. In my web development I try to make aestheticly pleasing websites, web apps, or random fun projects. Thinking outside the box to come up with creative software solutions for real world problems is my absolute favorite thing to do.

An enthusiastic guy

Enthusiastic, eager to learn and always looking for a challenge; this sums me up quite well. I like to engage in a whole bunch of different activities and projects. I always used to be part of the student council at my school and am still part of physics association VVN where I am a board member & co√∂rdinator of communications, PR and graphic design. This includes social media management, the design and distribution of promotional material and reaching out to students face-to-face.

What is he capable of?

Technologies

Click/hover the buttons for more information

Software development

Familliar with software development and agile methodologies. Keywords: analysis, object-oriënted design, database design, object-oriënted programming and testing . My education was heavily focussed around these subjects, including the practical application of these concepts in projects. Goals for the near future include trying Xamarin, Ionic or Flutter for cross-platform mobile apps; and Blazor for Web-Assembly apps.

Responsive Web Development

Mainly full stack software development with .NET Core, both MVC and API. Currently building a web-app with a .NET Core GraphQL API backend and an Angular frontend (including Apollo). Goals for the near future include experimenting with other front-end frameworks (Vue, React ...), other types of databases (MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Firebase ...), serverless architecture, headless CMS and many more.
